meanings.definition: characteristic of, suitable for, or relating to youth
meanings.sent1: The youthy group of friends enjoyed playing outdoor games together.
meanings.sent2: She had a youthy energy that made her popular among her classmates.
meanings.sent3: The youthy puppy kept running around in circles, chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as youthy as a bubbling stream in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The youthy colors of the painting brought a sense of joy and vitality to the room.

meanings.definition: having the qualities or characteristics of youth
meanings.sent1: His youthy enthusiasm for learning inspired his classmates.
meanings.sent2: The youthy spirit of the team helped them overcome challenges.
meanings.sent3: The youthy kitten pounced playfully on a ball of yarn.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a youthy tone that reminded him of carefree days.
meanings.sent5: The youthy glow of her skin made her look years younger than she was.

meanings.definition: pertaining to or characteristic of young people
meanings.sent1: The youthy fashion trends were always changing rapidly.
meanings.sent2: He enjoyed the youthy music played at the party.
meanings.sent3: The youthy group of friends giggled uncontrollably at the joke.
meanings.sent4: Her room was decorated in a youthy style with bright colors.
meanings.sent5: The youthy slang they used made the older adults confused but amused.
